alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Franklin; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Kearney; Nuckolls; Phelps; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 05 at 12:34PM CST until January 06 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 to 29 below zero. North winds of 15 to 20 MPH are expected along with gusts to around 25 MPH. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from noon today to 6 AM CST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Blowing and drifting snow could reduce visibility at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Dawson; Franklin; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Kearney; Nuckolls; Phelps; Webster
